name: "The Good Place" - "Pilot" Episode Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which former "Veronica Mars" actress played Eleanor?
questions.explanation:
Kristen Bell.

	Only Bell was ever on "Veronica Mars". Bell was born in Michigan and got her first big break with "Veronica Mars". She has also been in "Heroes" on TV and several movies.

Hit by a truck.

	The truck that hit her was carrying an erectile dysfunction billboard. She was in a grocery store parking lot when she was pushed out into the street and struck by the truck.

questions.text: What was the name of the man from Calgary who guessed 92% of the after-life correctly?
questions.explanation:
Doug Forcett.

	Michael (Played by Ted Danson) told Eleanor that every religion on Earth got about 5% of the after-life correct. Then he told her that Doug Forcett got stoned one night and launched into a rant where he got 92% of it right. Michael had a portrait of Doug on the wall of his office.

questions.text: What was in every neighborhood in "The Good Place"?
questions.explanation:
Frozen yogurt stores.

	Every neighborhood in the after-life had 322 people living in it. Each neighborhood has specifically designed to be the best place for those people. Michael said the only thing the same about every neighborhood was the frozen yogurt places.

questions.text: Eleanor was in "The Good Place" by mistake.
questions.explanation:
True.

	During her orientation she discovered that most artists, and all the U.S. Presidents other than Lincoln were in the "other" place.  She was told it's a very selective system. The only catch, she didn't do what they claimed she did while on Earth. She was a hard drinking and smoking person who was generally rude to others.

questions.text: What did Chidi Anagonye do before he died?
questions.correct: He was an ethics professor who was born in Nigeria.
options: He was a show salesman born in Chicago.
He was a chef born in Great Britain.
He was a politician born in Canada.
questions.explanation:
He was an ethics professor who was born in Nigeria.

	He and Eleanor were soulmates, as all people in "The Good Place" have their soulmate with them. Eleanor made him promise to never say or do anything to hurt her, and then told him her secret about her real life and how she wasn't supposed to be there.

questions.text: What did Eleanor do for a living before she died?
questions.explanation:
Sold fake medicine.

	She worked for a company that sold a product called Nasopro. The product was a fake medicine, aimed at the sick and elderly. It was actually a chalk powder.

questions.text: Where was Eleanor from before she died?
questions.explanation:
Arizona.

	She was born in Phoenix, went to college in Tempe and then moved back to Phoenix. On the contrast, the person they thought she was, had travelled the world as a humanitarian.

questions.text: Eleanor hated her neighbors in "The Good Place".
questions.explanation:
True.

	Her neighbor lived in a mansion, while she lived in a small cottage. Every house was designed to be the perfect residence for each person. Eleanor didn't like her house, but it was designed for the woman she was mistaken to be. The neighbors were Tahani and Jianyu.

questions.text: Giant robots attacked the neighborhood on Eleanor's second day in "The Good Place".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Giant representations from Eleanor's life attacked the entire neighborhood. There were large medicine bottles, giant ladybugs, huge forks and many other strange happenings. None of the giant items were robots.
